#!/usr/bin/ng

// Start a web server to serve files.
import "net/http"
pwd := $$ echo $PWD $$
h := http.FileServer(http.Dir(pwd))
http.ListenAndServe(":8080", h)

Download
Weekly binary releases will start when Go 1.10 is released in January 2018. (With it come several necessary plugin fixes and support on macOS.)

In the mean time, you can build neugram from HEAD with:
go install neugram.io/ng

links.title: Chronostasis - Wikipedia
links.description: Chronostasis (from Greek χρόνος, chrónos, "time" and στάσις, stásis, "standing") is a type of temporal illusion in which the first impression following the introduction of a new event or task-demand to the brain can appear to be extended in time.[1] For example, chronostasis temporarily occurs when fixating on a target stimulus, immediately following a saccade (i.e., quick eye movement). This elicits an overestimation in the temporal duration for...

links.description: In philosophy and certain models of psychology, qualia (/ˈkwɑːliə/ or /ˈkweɪliə/; singular form: quale) are defined as individual instances of subjective, conscious experience. links.title: Purchasing power parity - Wikipedia

Depthwise convolution is becoming increasingly popular in modern efficient

systematically study the impact of different kernel sizes, and observe that

convolution (MDConv), which naturally mixes up multiple kernel sizes in a

links.description: NOTE: The FTC hosted an IN-PERSON press conference at FTC Headquarters, 600 Pennsylvania Ave, NW, Washington D.
links.original_title: FTC Imposes $5B Penalty and Sweeping New Privacy Restrictions on Facebook

links.title: Rohit Chopra on Twitter
links.description: “The government just announced its proposed settlement with Facebook for its privacy failures. $5 billion sounds like a lot, but the fine print in the settlement has a lot for $FB to celebrate. I voted no. Here’s why.”

links.title: Sign Up
links.description: 500 million+ members | Manage your professional identity. Build and engage with your professional network. Access knowledge, insights and opportunities.

links.title: Facebook asked some users for their email passwords, because why not
links.description: And two third-party developers left the data from millions of Facebook users exposed in S3 bucket.

links.title: Facebook admits using two-factor phone numbers to target ads
links.description: There are two-factor alternatives you can use instead of your phone number.

links.title: Facebook Faces Class Action Lawsuit Challenging Its Use Of Facial Recognition Data
links.description: Facebook users in Illinois argue that the company has violated their privacy rights under state law and the damages could amount to billions of dollars.

links.title: FTC hits Facebook with $5 billion fine and new privacy checks
links.description: The largest penalty ever levied against a tech company

links.title: ashkan soltani on Twitter
links.description:
“@facebook @TheJusticeDept @megangrA 6) *HOLY CRAP*: the FTC settlement indemnifies @Facebook for "any and all claims prior to June 12, 2019"

No wonder FB is willing to pay $5B
(Also not a surprise that it was a 3-2 vote)

Only a subset of the potential FTC violations reported since 2018 are covered (see the list)”

links.title: Alex Stamos on Twitter
links.description:
“The real threat to the tech giants is competition, not regulation, and everybody is missing what really happened today:

Facebook paid the FTC $5B for a letter that says "You never again have to create mechanisms that could facilitate competition." https://t.co/djpmwCTbIu”

links.title: Mark Zuckerberg called early Facebook users dumb f***s for sharing data, giving up privacy
links.description: Zuckerberg's "dumb f**k" came while he was chatting with a friend in Harvard, reports the Business Insider. Here is the chat went.

links.title: Bloomberg - Are you a robot?
links.description: To continue, please click the box below to let us know you're not a robot.

links.title: Facebook Fined While Murderers Go Free
links.description: Facebook received a record fine for privacy violations that weren't even really their fault as they were abused by unethical app companies. Everyone has been up

links.original_title: Mithril.js 2.0 Released

links.title: Migrating from v1.x - Mithril.js
links.description: v2.x is almost entirely API-compatible with v1.x, but there are some breaking changes.

links.title: Migrating from v0.2.x - Mithril.js
links.description: v1.x and v2.x are largely API-compatible with v0.2.x, but there are some breaking changes. Migrating to v2.x is nearly identical, so the notes below apply mostly to both.

links.title: The Bristol Brabazon Was The Prettiest Piece Of Useless Scrap Ever
links.description: You have to admire a man like John Brabazon, not only for having an incredible license plate, but also for being the first person to fly a plane in Britain. And not only did he do that, but he also had a splendid plane named after him. A splendid, worthless, beautiful, useless, wonderful, horrible elephant of a plane.
links.original_title: The Bristol Brabazon Was a Pretty Piece of Useless Scrap
